metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000025 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: GNOME Web (Epiphany) 3.23 before 3.23.5, 3.22 before 3.22.6, 3.20 before 3.20.7, 3.18 before 3.18.11, and prior versions, is vulnerable to a password manager sweep attack resulting in the remote exfiltration of stored passwords for a selected set of websites.

criterions.comment: epiphany package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
epiphany-browser package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.28.6-0ubuntu1').
